main event: On 15 March 1951, a cigar-shaped UFO was sighted in New Delhi, India, by about 25 witnesses, including a Senior Mechanical Engineer, spanning a length of 70 ft, and exhibiting erratic movements such as making loops and zig-zags. The object remained stationary for about 100 ft and was estimated to have a top speed of about 2,000 mph.
interesting points: The object was an estimated 70 ft long and remained stationary for about 100 ft, exhibiting erratic movements and an estimated top speed of about 2,000 mph.

It was observed by about 25 witnesses, including a Senior Mechanical Engineer who worked for the Ministry of Technology and was now the Director of the Research and Development Laboratory of the Ministry of Defence, Government of India.
The color of the object was described as dull and dark, with a whitish cloud initially appearing about 70 ft long and believed to be at an altitude of 3-4,000 ft.

The object was estimated to be about 3 times greater than the full moon size and was sighted at an altitude of about 4500 to 5000 feet, exhibiting a light blue color in the center fading into yellowish white near the edges.
The case was investigated by the Directorate of Air Intelligence and by the Director of the Research and Development Laboratory of the Ministry of Defence, Government of India.
witnesses: Senior Mechanical Engineer, about 25 other observers
